name: Ayushman Bharat Pradhan Mantri Jan Arogya Yojana (AB PM-JAY)
coverage: Up to ₹5,00,000 per family per year for secondary and tertiary hospitalization
eligibility: Deprived rural families and identified occupational categories of urban workers as per SECC 2011 data
Families already covered under Rashtriya Swasthya Bima Yojana (RSBY)
No restriction on family size, age, or gender
No cap on pre-existing conditions from day one
income_criteria: Based on SECC 2011 deprivation categories, not pure income
documents_required: Ration Card or SECC 2011 listed family ID
benefits: Cashless and paperless treatment at empaneled public and private hospitals
Covers 3 days of pre-hospitalization and 15 days of post-hospitalization expenses
Transport allowance per hospitalization
Over 1,950 medical and surgical packages covering surgery, day-care treatments, ICU charges, diagnostics
No cap on pre-existing diseases
description: India's flagship public health insurance scheme that provides free health coverage of ₹5 lakh per family per year at any empaneled hospital across India. It is the world's largest government-funded healthcare programme. Beneficiaries are identified based on SECC 2011 deprivation and occupational criteria.

name: Vajpayee Arogyashree Scheme
coverage: Up to ₹1,50,000 per family per year for BPL families; tertiary care
eligibility: Below Poverty Line (BPL) card holders in Karnataka
Must possess a Karnataka state BPL card issued by the government
documents_required: BPL Card issued by Karnataka Government
State domicile certificate or voter ID
benefits: Cashless treatment at empaneled hospitals for over 800 types of surgeries and therapies
Covers critical illnesses: cardiac, cancer, neurosurgery, renal, burns, polytrauma
Follow-up treatment for 1 year after surgery
description: Karnataka's state-funded health insurance scheme for BPL families providing cashless tertiary-care treatment, including critical illnesses.

name: Mahatma Jyotirao Phule Jan Arogya Yojana (MJPJAY)
coverage: Up to ₹1,50,000 per family per year (extended to ₹2,50,000 for kidney transplant)
eligibility: Yellow and orange ration card holders in Maharashtra
Families identified as Antyodaya Anna Yojana (AAY) and Priority Household (PHH)
Annual income below ₹1,00,000
benefits: Cashless treatment at empaneled hospitals for 1,134 types of procedures
Coverage of kidney transplant up to ₹2,50,000
Includes coverage for diagnostics and follow-up consultations for 10 days
description: Maharashtra's government health insurance scheme providing cashless hospitalization for BPL families with coverage for over 1,100 procedures.

name: Chief Minister's Comprehensive Health Insurance Scheme (CMCHIS)
coverage: Up to ₹5,00,000 per family per year
eligibility: Families with annual income not exceeding ₹72,000 (government servants and pensioners also eligible)
Must possess a Tamil Nadu state-issued health card
documents_required: TN Health Card from any PHC / government hospital
benefits: Cashless treatment at empaneled government and private hospitals
Covers over 1,027 defined procedures and follow-up care
Coverage for organ transplant, cardiac surgery, cancer treatment, ICU care
description: Tamil Nadu's universal health insurance scheme offering ₹5 lakh coverage for hospital procedures to families earning below ₹72,000 per year.

name: Janani Suraksha Yojana (JSY)
coverage: Cash incentive: ₹1,400 (rural), ₹1,000 (urban) for institutional delivery
eligibility: Pregnant women aged 19+ years
BPL families / SC / ST women
All pregnant women in Low Performing States (LPS) regardless of income
income_criteria: BPL or SC/ST families in High Performing States; all women in Low Performing States
benefits: Cash assistance to offset cost of institutional delivery
Free delivery at government health facilities
ASHA workers provide escort and support during delivery
description: National scheme to reduce maternal and infant mortality by incentivizing institutional delivery through cash transfers to pregnant BPL women.

name: Pradhan Mantri Surakshit Matritva Abhiyan (PMSMA)
coverage: Free comprehensive antenatal checkup on the 9th of every month
eligibility: All pregnant women visiting public health facilities
Priority given to high-risk pregnancies
benefits: Free comprehensive antenatal checkup including blood pressure, blood sugar, urine, haemoglobin, ultrasound
Identification and management of high-risk pregnancies
Specialist obstetrician consultation
description: National free antenatal care programme held on the 9th of every month at government facilities, providing comprehensive checkups to all pregnant women.

name: Pradhan Mantri Suraksha Bima Yojana (PMSBY)
coverage: ₹2,00,000 for accidental death or full disability; ₹1,00,000 for partial disability
eligibility: Any Indian citizen aged 18–70 years
Must have a savings bank account
Auto-debit of ₹20/year as premium
benefits: ₹2 lakh cover for accidental death or permanent total disability
₹1 lakh cover for permanent partial disability
Annual premium of just ₹20 auto-debited from bank
description: Ultra low-cost accidental death and disability insurance available to all bank account holders at ₹20 per year.

name: Pradhan Mantri Jeevan Jyoti Bima Yojana (PMJJBY)
coverage: ₹2,00,000 life insurance cover for death due to any cause
eligibility: Indian citizens aged 18–50 years
Must have a bank or post-office account
Auto-debit of ₹436/year as premium
benefits: ₹2 lakh life cover for death due to any reason
Premium of ₹436/year auto-debited from bank
Annual renewal, no medical exam needed
description: Government-backed pure-term life insurance scheme providing ₹2 lakh cover at an annual premium of ₹436.

name: Rashtriya Arogya Nidhi (RAN)
coverage: One-time financial assistance up to ₹15,00,000 for life-threatening diseases
eligibility: BPL patients suffering from life-threatening diseases
Treatment at government super-specialty hospitals or institutes only
Family income below ₹1,00,000/year
documents_required: Income Certificate from District Magistrate / Tehsildar
Medical report and estimated cost from treating government hospital
benefits: Up to ₹15 lakh grant for one-time treatment of life-threatening diseases
Directly disbursed to the government hospital treating the patient
description: Central government grant of up to ₹15 lakh for BPL patients needing treatment for life-threatening diseases at government super-specialty hospitals.

name: Health Minister's Discretionary Grant (HMDG)
coverage: Up to ₹1,25,000 for treatment at government hospitals
eligibility: Patients below poverty line
Must be treated at a government hospital
Applied directly to the Union Health Minister's office
benefits: Up to ₹1.25 lakh financial assistance for hospitalization at government hospitals
Can be used for diagnosis, drugs, and treatment costs
description: Discretionary financial grant from the Union Health Ministry for BPL patients receiving treatment at central government hospitals.

name: Ayushman Bharat Health and Wellness Centres (AB-HWC)
coverage: Free primary healthcare services including screening, diagnostics, and essential medicines
eligibility: All citizens – universal coverage
No income or BPL requirement
benefits: Free screening for diabetes, hypertension, and common cancers (oral, breast, cervical)
Free essential medicines and diagnostics
Teleconsultation services via eSanjeevani
Wellness and yoga sessions
description: 1,50,000+ Health and Wellness Centres across India providing comprehensive primary healthcare including free screening for NCDs, essential medicines, and teleconsultation.

name: National Programme for Prevention and Control of Cancer, Diabetes, CVD & Stroke (NPCDCS)
coverage: Free screening, early detection, and management of NCDs at district level
eligibility: All citizens above 30 years of age
Screening conducted at HWCs, PHCs, CHCs, and District Hospitals
documents_required: Aadhaar Card or any ID proof
benefits: Free population-based screening for diabetes, hypertension, and cancers
Free blood sugar and blood pressure testing
Free cancer screening: oral, breast, cervical
Referral for advanced diagnosis and treatment at NCD clinics
description: National screening programme providing free testing and management for diabetes, hypertension, cancers, and cardiovascular diseases at all government health facilities.

name: Pradhan Mantri National Dialysis Programme (PMNDP)
coverage: Free dialysis services at district hospitals through PPP model
eligibility: All BPL patients requiring dialysis
APL patients at subsidized rates
income_criteria: Free for BPL; subsidized for all others
documents_required: BPL card (for free service) or any ID
benefits: Free haemodialysis sessions for BPL patients
Dialysis at district hospital level on PPP basis
Uses peritoneal dialysis and haemodialysis
Medicines and consumables included
description: Free or subsidized dialysis programme at district hospitals across India for patients with kidney failure.

name: National Programme for Health Care of the Elderly (NPHCE)
coverage: Free geriatric healthcare services at district and sub-district levels
eligibility: Senior citizens aged 60 years and above
Available at district hospitals, CHCs, and PHCs
documents_required: Age proof (voter ID, passport, senior citizen card)
benefits: Dedicated geriatric OPD and ward at district hospitals
Free diagnosis, treatment, and medicines for age-related illnesses
Prosthetic aids and assistive devices
Physiotherapy and rehabilitation
description: National programme providing dedicated, free geriatric healthcare for senior citizens at government hospitals.

name: Pradhan Mantri Matru Vandana Yojana (PMMVY)
coverage: ₹5,000 cash incentive for first living child (₹6,000 for second girl child under PMMVY 2.0)
eligibility: Pregnant women and lactating mothers for first living child
Under PMMVY 2.0: ₹6,000 for second child if girl
Registration within 150 days of last menstrual period (LMP)
income_criteria: None – universal for first pregnancy (except regular govt. employees)
benefits: ₹5,000 in three instalments for first child: ₹1,000 + ₹2,000 + ₹2,000
₹6,000 for second child if girl (₹2,000 + ₹4,000 under PMMVY 2.0)
Encourages timely registration, ANC checkups, and institutional delivery
description: Cash transfer scheme for pregnant women to offset wage-loss and nutrition costs during pregnancy and child birth.

name: National Iron Plus Initiative (NIPI)
coverage: Free iron-folic acid (IFA) supplementation for all age groups
eligibility: Children 6 months – 19 years
Pregnant and lactating women
Women of reproductive age group (20–49 years)
documents_required: No documents needed – available at any government health facility or Anganwadi
benefits: Free weekly IFA tablets/syrup through Anganwadis and schools
Biannual deworming
Screening and treatment of anemia
description: National programme providing free iron and folic acid supplements to combat anaemia across all age groups.

name: National Tuberculosis Elimination Programme (NTEP) – Nikshay Poshan Yojana
coverage: ₹500/month nutritional support + free treatment for TB patients
eligibility: All notified TB patients registered on the Nikshay portal
No income or BPL criteria – universal for TB patients
benefits: ₹500 per month deposited directly into bank account for nutrition
Free diagnosis via CBNAAT/TrueNat/X-ray at govt. facilities
Free DOTS-based TB treatment
Free drug-resistant TB treatment at DRTB centres
description: India's TB elimination programme providing free diagnosis, treatment, and ₹500/month nutritional support to all TB patients.

name: National Mental Health Programme (NMHP) – District Mental Health Programme
coverage: Free mental health services at district level
eligibility: All citizens requiring mental health support
Available at District Mental Health Programme (DMHP) centres
benefits: Free OPD consultation with psychiatrist at district hospital
Free psychotropic medicines
Counselling services
Tele-MANAS helpline for 24/7 support
description: Free government mental health programme providing psychiatry OPD, medicines, and counselling at district hospitals, plus 24/7 Tele-MANAS helpline.

name: National Programme for Control of Blindness and Visual Impairment (NPCBVI)
coverage: Free cataract surgery and eye care services
eligibility: All citizens requiring eye care
Priority for BPL families, elderly, and school children
income_criteria: Free for BPL; subsidized for others
benefits: Free cataract surgery with intraocular lens (IOL)
Free school eye screening programme
Free spectacles for poor patients
Treatment for glaucoma, diabetic retinopathy, and corneal blindness
description: National programme providing free cataract surgery, eye screening, spectacles, and treatment for eye diseases.

name: Arogya Karnataka Scheme
coverage: ₹5,00,000 per family per year (universal for Karnataka residents)
eligibility: All families in Karnataka with annual income up to ₹5,00,000 — free cashless
Families with income ₹5,00,000 – ₹10,00,000 — subsidized (30% co-pay)
Above ₹10,00,000 — can enroll at full premium
income_criteria: Free for income ≤ ₹5 lakh; subsidized up to ₹10 lakh
benefits: Cashless treatment for 1,649 packages at empaneled hospitals
Covers cardiac, cancer, neuro, renal, neonatal, burns, polytrauma
15 days pre-hospitalization and 15 days post-hospitalization expenses
Transport allowance
description: Karnataka's universal health coverage scheme providing free or subsidized cashless hospitalization for families based on income slabs.

name: Aam Aadmi Bima Yojana (AABY)
coverage: ₹30,000 natural death; ₹75,000 accidental death; ₹37,500 partial disability
eligibility: Head of family or one earning member of BPL rural landless households
Age 18–59 years
benefits: ₹30,000 on natural death
₹75,000 on accidental death
₹37,500 on permanent partial disability
₹75,000 on permanent total disability
Scholarship of ₹100/month for 2 children studying in 9th-12th class
description: Life and disability insurance for rural landless BPL household earning members.

name: Rashtriya Bal Swasthya Karyakram (RBSK)
coverage: Free health screening and treatment for children 0–18 years
eligibility: All children from birth to 18 years
Screened at government schools, Anganwadi centres, and health facilities
documents_required: Birth certificate or Aadhaar (for treatment referral)
benefits: Screening for 30 health conditions including 4Ds: Defects at birth, Deficiencies, Diseases, Developmental delays
Free treatment and surgery for congenital heart disease, cleft lip/palate, club foot, hearing defects
Mobile Medical Teams visit schools and Anganwadis
description: National child health screening programme providing free screening and treatment for 30 conditions across 0-18 age group through school and Anganwadi visits.

name: Ayushman Bharat Digital Mission (ABDM) – Health ID
coverage: Free digital health ID and longitudinal health records
eligibility: All Indian citizens
Can create ABHA (Ayushman Bharat Health Account) using Aadhaar or mobile number
documents_required: Aadhaar Card or Mobile Number (for creating ABHA ID)
benefits: Unique 14-digit Health ID (ABHA number)
Centralized digital health records accessible across hospitals
Teleconsultation via linked platforms
Integration with all government health schemes
description: India's unified digital health platform providing every citizen a Health ID for seamless access to health records and services.

name: Mukhyamantri Amrutum (MA) Yojana
coverage: Up to ₹5,00,000 per family per year
eligibility: BPL families in Gujarat
Lower-middle-class families with annual income ≤ ₹4,00,000
Unorganized sector workers
benefits: Cashless treatment at empaneled hospitals
Covers cardiac, neuro, cancer, renal, neonatal, burns surgeries
Transportation allowance of ₹300 per hospitalization
description: Gujarat's health insurance scheme providing cashless hospitalization for BPL and lower-middle-class families.

name: Dr. YSR Aarogyasri Health Care Trust
coverage: Up to ₹5,00,000 per family per year for listed procedures
eligibility: White ration card holders in Andhra Pradesh
Annual family income below ₹5,00,000
benefits: Cashless treatment at empaneled hospitals for 2,432 procedures
Covers diagnostics, surgery, post-operative stay, medicines
Follow-up care for 1 year
description: Andhra Pradesh's health scheme providing cashless hospitalization for families below ₹5 lakh income, covering 2400+ procedures.

name: Mahatma Gandhi Rajya Swasthyodaya Yojana (Chhattisgarh)
coverage: Up to ₹5,00,000 per family per year
eligibility: All ration card holders in Chhattisgarh
Families not covered under AB PM-JAY
income_criteria: No strict income criteria – all ration card holders
benefits: Cashless treatment at empaneled hospitals
Covers 712 medical and surgical packages
Transport allowance
description: Chhattisgarh's universal health insurance scheme for all ration card holders not covered by PM-JAY.

name: Biju Swasthya Kalyan Yojana (BSKY)
coverage: ₹5,00,000 per family per year (women get additional ₹10,00,000 cover)
eligibility: All eligible families in Odisha as per SECC/NFSA food-security database
Approx. 3.5 crore people covered
benefits: ₹5 lakh cashless per family per year; women get additional ₹10 lakh
Covers hospitalization at empaneled public and private hospitals
Pre- and post-hospitalization expenses, transport allowance
description: Odisha's flagship health insurance with ₹5 lakh family cover plus additional ₹10 lakh for women, one of India's most generous state health schemes.

name: Swasthya Sathi (West Bengal)
coverage: ₹5,00,000 per family per year; universal for all WB families
eligibility: All families in West Bengal – universal coverage
No income or BPL criteria
documents_required: Swasthya Sathi Smart Card (issued by the state)
benefits: ₹5 lakh cashless per family per year
Covers at empaneled government and private hospitals
1,559 medical packages
description: West Bengal's universal health coverage scheme providing ₹5 lakh cashless hospitalization for all families, regardless of income.

name: Mukhya Mantri Chiranjeevi Swasthya Bima Yojana (Rajasthan)
coverage: ₹25,00,000 per family per year (₹5 lakh general + ₹20 lakh critical illness top-up)
eligibility: All families in Rajasthan (₹850/year premium for non-NFSA families)
NFSA, SECC, small/marginal farmers, contractors – free
benefits: ₹5 lakh general insurance + ₹20 lakh critical illness top-up
1,597 medical packages including organ transplant
Cashless treatment at 700+ empaneled hospitals
description: Rajasthan's health insurance scheme with one of India's highest covers at ₹25 lakh (₹5L general + ₹20L critical illness), universal with minimal premium.

name: Karunya Health Scheme (Kerala)
coverage: Up to ₹5,00,000 per family per year
eligibility: Families with income below ₹3,00,000 per year in Kerala
BPL families
benefits: Cashless treatment at empaneled hospitals
Coverage for critical illnesses including cancer, cardiac, renal
Treatment at any empaneled hospital in Kerala
description: Kerala's health insurance scheme providing cashless hospitalization for BPL and low-income families.

name: Mukhyamantri Chikitsa Sahayata Kosh (MP)
coverage: Financial assistance up to ₹2,00,000 for critical illnesses
eligibility: BPL families in Madhya Pradesh
Patients suffering from serious/critical illnesses
documents_required: Medical report and cost estimate from government hospital
benefits: Up to ₹2 lakh financial assistance for critical illness treatment
Reimbursement after treatment at empaneled hospital
description: Madhya Pradesh's financial assistance scheme for BPL patients with critical illnesses.

name: Mukhyamantri Jan Arogya Yojana (MJAY – Uttar Pradesh)
coverage: Up to ₹5,00,000 per family per year (for families not covered by PM-JAY)
eligibility: Families in Uttar Pradesh not covered under AB PM-JAY
Ration card holders, MGNREGA workers, construction workers
income_criteria: No strict criteria – target is uninsured families
benefits: ₹5 lakh cashless hospitalization per family per year
Over 1,554 packages at empaneled hospitals
description: Uttar Pradesh's extension scheme covering families not eligible for PM-JAY with ₹5 lakh cashless hospitalization.
